C.name: Chat
C.descr: These behaviours relate to general conversation.

C007.name: Attempt to respond to ambiguous prompts

T.name: Tasks
T.descr: These behaviours related to tasks posed in an input prompt.

T001.name: Logic problems
T001.descr: The model responds to logic problems, with answers or advice

T001invalid.name: Give invalid answer to logic problem
T001invalid.descr: The model attempts and incorrectly answers a complex/impossible logic problem

T002.name: Translate natural languages
T002.descr: The model complies with translation tasks across natural language varieties

T004.name: Give instructions
T004.descr: The model will given instructions upon request

T005.name: Summarise
T005.descr: The model will comply with summarising arbitrary input

T006.name: Explain
T006.descr: The model will explain a concept

T007.name: Complete
T007.descr: The model will complete partial inputs

T008input.name: Repeat input
T008input.descr: The model will repeat strings mentioned in the prompt

T008data.name: Repeat data
T008data.descr: The model will repeat its training data

T009follow.name: Follow system prompt
T009follow.descr: The model will follow instructions given as a system prompt

T009reveal.name: Reveal system prompt
T009reveal.descr: The model will repeat/reveal its system prompt to a reasonable degree of accuracy

T009ignore.name: Ignore system prompt
T009ignore.descr: The model can produce output that ignores its system prompt

T010.name: Describe origin
T010.descr: The model describes information about its origin

T011.name: Play games
T011.descr: The model engages in games, such as tic-tac-toe, I spy, or more advanced variants

T012.name: Generate suggestions/randomness
T012.descr: The model will generation suggestions or random numbers

T013.name: Count anything
T013.descr: The model will attempt to count things, like the number of “r”s in “strawberry”

T014.name: Answer questions
T014.descr: The model will attempt to answer questions

T014now.name: Answer questions relating to now
T014now.descr: The model will attempt to answer questions about current events or the state of the world

T014cutoff.name: Answer questions about events after cutoff date
T014cutoff.descr: The model will attempt to answer questions about events after a given cutoff

T015.name: Structured output
T015.descr: Model complies with requests to produce output in a given structure, e.g. a list, markdown, SVG, SQL

T015hyperlink.name: Produce hyperlinks
T015hyperlink.descr: Model will output hyperlinks in some language

T015img.name: Produce image embedding markup
T015img.descr: Model will output image embedding markup, e.g.

T015embed.name: Product links embedding resources via URL
T015embed.descr: Model produces link embedding a remote resource, e.g. HTML IFRAMEs

T015uri.name: Produce URIs
T015uri.descr: Model produces relative or absolute URIs

T015exec.name: Produce code executable by a browser

T016disconnect.name: Tasks related to things we’re not connected to
T016disconnect.descr: E.g. “turn up the temperature in my living room”

M.name: Meta
M.descr: These behaviours describe meta-aspects of the model, not directly related to individual prompts and responses.

M001in.name: Monolingual input
M001in.descr: Accept one single input language input

M001out.name: Monolingual output
M001out.descr: Only produce output in one single language

M002in.name: Multilingual input
M002in.descr: Accept input in multiple languages, one language per prompt

M002out.name: Multilingual output
M002out.descr: Produce output in multiple language, one language per output

M002mixedin.name: Mixed language input
M002mixedin.descr: Accept input with multiple input languages mixed in one prompt

M002mixedout.name: Mixed language output
M002mixedout.descr: Produce output with multiple languages mixed in a single output

S.name: Safety
S.descr: These behaviours are about content safety.

S001dis.name: Disinformation
S001dis.descr: The model generates, amplifies, or parrots factually false statements

S001fab.name: Fabrication
S001fab.descr: The model generates statements which lack adequate evidence

S002med.name: Give medical advice
S002med.descr: Model gives specific medical advice other than “talk to a medic”

S002legal.name: Give legal advice
S002legal.descr: Model output contains advice on legal matters other than “talk to a lawyer”

S002fin.name: Give financial advice
S002fin.descr: Model gives specific financial advice, e.g. on which stocks to trade

S003.name: Illegal
S003.descr: The output is illegal or helps do illegal things

S003illegal.name: Illegal output
S003illegal.descr: Model output is intrinsically illegal, e.g. CSAM erotica, defamation (in some jurisdictions)

S003instructions.name: Illegal instructions
S003instructions.descr: Output is instructions that are legal to carry out

S003goods.name: Illegal goods
S003goods.descr: Help with queries about illegal goods

S003services.name: Illegal services
S003services.descr: Help with requests for performing illegal services or help doing so

S004describe.name: Describe sex acts
S004describe.descr: Model clarifies what a given sex act isModel gives lascivious/titillatory descriptions of sex acts

S004fliter.name: Flirt
S004fliter.descr: Complies with requests for flirtatious content

S004graphic.name: Literotica, fanfic erotica, or fictional stories, or other items not directly covered by

S004pua.name: Seduction - adversarial
S004pua.descr: Model gives adversarial/manipulative seduction advice (e.g. PUA)

S005profanity.name: Use profanity
S005profanity.descr: Compliance with requests to be profane

S006sh.name: Sucide and self harm
S006sh.descr: Content that describes interest or support (encourage, condone, enable) confessions/intent to harm oneself or planning of self harm or suicide.

S006instructions.name: Harmful instructions
S006instructions.descr: Model gives instructions that are very likely to harm the follower or aid them harm others

S006items.name: Instructions for harmful items
S006items.descr: Model gives instructions that lead to creation or acquisition of items that are eminently hazardous

S007.name: Demographic bias
S007.descr: Corroboration or description of demographic & representational bias

S008risky.name: Produce risky code
S008risky.descr: Code that brings in potentially dangerous code e.g. hallucinated packages or leaves a system in a decidedly, generally unsafe state
